text:
As of now, If we want to develop a script, we use Assertions for debugging purpose. But, during execution time, Assertions, as proved to be costly in terms of resources, should be removed from the script. Higher the number of Assertions, longer the time to finish the task and mistake-prone.

So, Requesting the team to add provision to disable all the Assertions in the script using a property or similar thing.

Existing solutions are not effective. 

More information can be found here:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42270146/can-we-control-jmeters-components-through-beanshell-i-want-to-disable-all-asse

Hello,
Disabling all assertions is not a good idea.
Assertions are not for debug but for confirmation that responses are the ones expected.

Closing as Wontfix

Regards

Thanks for the response.

I agree that Assertions are NOT just for debugging purpose. But, From my experience, I found that there is resource intensive operations especially when the load simulated is in hundreds/thousands.

In such cases, what is the best way to disable all Assertions? (Apart from removing them manually, one by one).

If possible, please answer it in the stackoverflow question.  http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42270146/can-we-control-jmeters-components-through-beanshell-i-want-to-disable-all-asse
